name: thedailybeast
text: NEW: President Trump’s most influential supporters in the media were so desperate for Trump’s approval that they frequently humiliated themselves to win it, according to the just-released memoir by Michael Cohen https://t.co/rr4IO1E9Eb

name: thedailybeast
text: During the early GOP primary race, Cohen writes, Sean Hannity was distraught about being “put in the penalty box” by the Trump campaign after then-campaign manager Corey Lewandowski told Trump that Hannity was a secret Ted Cruz supporter https://t.co/rr4IO1E9Eb

name: thedailybeast
text: “Mr. Trump, Lewandowski’s a piece of shit and a liar,” Hannity said over the phone, according to Cohen. “I can’t come out publicly to endorse you at this time. It would destroy my credibility as it relates to you...” https://t.co/rr4IO1E9Eb

name: thedailybeast
text:
“But I want you to know that I am today and have always been behind you,” Hannity continued. 

The groveling didn't stop there. Cohen also described his dealings with Roger Ailes at Fox News and David Pecker at the fact-challenged tabloid company AMI. https://t.co/rr4IO1E9Eb

name: thedailybeast
text: Kevin Dobson, best known for his roles in 1960s TV show "One Life to Live" and the 1970s crime detective show "Kojak," died on Sunday at the age of 77 https://t.co/e3YCD42vOz

name: thedailybeast
text: “It’s not about the truth,” Pecker allegedly told Cohen when the two attempted to bury one allegation of Trump sexually harassing a woman in Atlantic City. “I have been watching his back for years.” https://t.co/rr4IO1E9Eb

name: thedailybeast
text: Read the full story by @TheLloydGrove and @maxwelltani on Michael Cohen's new memoir here: https://t.co/GVf8C94TZv
